clinical_study.brief_title: Application of Analgesia/Nociception Index in Combined Spinal Epidural Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Analgesia/Nociception Index in Combined Spinal Epidural Anesthesia: an Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Analgesia Nociception Index can be used to detect noxious stimulation during general anesthesia.The aim of this study is to observe ANI under combined spinal epidural anesthesia.

detailed_description.textblock: Analgesia Nociception Index（ANI）which is derived by heart rate variability, can be used to detect noxious stimulation during general anesthesia. Combined spinal epidural anesthesia can affect heart rate variability by blocking anterior and posterior roots of spinal nerve and spinal cord. The aim of this study is to observe ANI under combined spinal epidural anesthesia.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from Baseline ANI after applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia
primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from Baseline ANI and 5 minutes after applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia
primary_outcome.description: ANI is derived from hear rate variability, ranging from 0-100. Bigger number means better analgesic level. 50-70 is considered to be under adequate analgesia.The number of ANI suppose to rise up after applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from Baseline Systolic Blood Pressure after applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline systolic blood pressure and 5 minutes after applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic Blood Pressure will go down after applied combined spinal epidural.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from Baseline Heart Rate after applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline heart rate and 5 minutes after applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Heart Rate will go up after applied combined spinal epidural. If block level is higher than T4, heart Rate is suppose to go down.

secondary_outcome.measure: ANI(combined spinal epidural anesthesia) changes after applied surgical incision incision
secondary_outcome.time_frame: ANI changes from applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia and 2 minutes, 4 minutes, 6 minutes after applied surgical incision.
secondary_outcome.description: The number of ANI suppose to stay still under surgical incision after applied adequate analgesia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Systolic Blood Pressure(combined spinal epidural) changes after applied surgical incision
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Systolic Blood Pressure changes from applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia and 2 minutes, 4 minutes, 6 minutes after applied surgical incision.
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic Blood Pressure will go up if patient is feeling pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Heart Rate(combined spinal epidural) changes after applied surgical incision
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Heart Rate changes from applied combined spinal epidural anesthesia and 2 minutes, 4 minutes, 6 minutes after applied surgical incision.
secondary_outcome.description: Heart Rate will go up if patient is feeling pain.

study_pop.textblock: Patients scheduled for elective surgery in combined spinal epidural anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 18- 65 years
- ASA physical status I or II
- Elective surgery in combined spinal epidural anesthesia planned
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of CNS-active medication or abuse of alcohol
- History of cardiac arrhythmia
- Contraindications of combined spinal epidural anesthesia
